scenarioDescription:
The HD 109286 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 109286 is a star with 0.98 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.09 times its radius. It is located 180.74 light years away from the solar system.

HD 109286 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 109286 system


HD 109286 b

HD 109286 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2021-07, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.26 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 109286 b is 950.820 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 109286 b is 13.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 109286 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 109286, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HD 109286 - System With 1 Exoplanet
